question: Which of the following is correct combination of masses of the three sub-atomic particles?
option1: Electron - 0. 00055 amu; Proton - 1.0078 amu; Neutron - 1.0083 amu
option2: Electron - 0. 00055 amu; Proton - 1.0083 amu; Neutron - 1.0078 amu
option3: Electron - 0. 00055 amu; Proton - 1.0078 amu; Neutron - 1.0078 amu
option4: Electron - 0. 00055 amu; Proton - 1.0083 amu; Neutron - 1.0083 amu
answer: Electron - 0. 00055 amu; Proton - 1.0078 amu; Neutron - 1.0083 amu
explanation: The correct mass of Electron is 0. 00055 amu; Proton is 1.0078 amu and Neutron is 1.0083 amu. Kindly note mass of neutron is slightly more than that of Proton.
